Material used.Description: GST-PINK1 112-496 constructs were purified from the soluble fraction of bacterial lysates.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D mutation showed decreased kinase activity to 60.5% of wild type.
L347P mutation drastically reduced kinase activity to less than 10% of wild type and was unstable.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control for kinase activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Artificial kinase-dead mutants (K219A/D362A/D384A) were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Fisher's PLSD post hoc test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity close to 100% of wild-type PINK1 activity.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity significantly below wild-type levels (e.g., less than 75% of wild-type activity).

Material used.Description: COS7 or M17 (human neuroblastoma) cells were transiently transfected with PINK1 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D mutation showed no significant effect on steady-state protein levels.
L347P mutation resulted in drastically decreased steady-state protein levels due to instability.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent means Â± SEM from at least triplicate determinations.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 constructs were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected cells were used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels comparable to wild-type PINK1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in protein levels compared to wild-type PINK1.

Material used.Description: COS7 cells were transfected with GFP or myc-tagged PINK1 constructs and stained with MitoTracker.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D mutation showed normal localization similar to wild-type PINK1.
L347P mutation showed much lower levels of immunostaining due to protein instability.

Biological replicates.Description: Each image is representative of at least three experiments performed in duplicate for each construct.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 constructs were used as positive controls for localization.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected cells were used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Localization pattern similar to wild-type PINK1, with overlap with mitochondrial markers.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced or altered localization signal compared to wild-type PINK1.

Material used.Description: COS7 cells were transiently transfected with GFP-tagged PINK1 for pulse-chase analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: G309D mutation was not specifically tested in pulse-chase analysis.
L347P mutation showed a significantly reduced half-life of 0.25 hours compared to 2 hours for wild-type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: Similar estimates of stability were obtained in duplicate experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control for protein stability.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein half-life similar to wild-type PINK1 (approximately 2 hours).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein half-life significantly shorter than wild-type PINK1 (e.g., less than 1 hour).
